ipaichamma, pas. pichamman, inichamman, inoichûmman, ipaicham, inipaicham, inoipûìcham, to drink, to offer to drink, aichan, nom. a drinking; ûichaman, a drinking cup.
pinaichasrra, papaichasarra, for the imp. people say, sarra o kagil, to sleep.
pinaies, papaies, aisa, ipaies, inipaies, inoipaies, to put away.
pinaya, papaya, aya, ayanni, inayanni, inoayanni, to lean backwards.
pinûyach, papayach, ayacha, ayachen, inayach, inoayachen, whence iachen, ipayach, iniachen, inipayach, inoipayach, to make dirty.
pinayoch, papayoch, ayocha, to turn back, also ayochan, inayochan, inoayochan, to give back.
pinaikiek, papaikiek, to crack.
pi, pa, idem.
trans. from Mikkap, which see.
pinûilieb, papûilieb, ailieba, ailieban, inailiban, inoailiban, to call, to fetch any one. Paailieb, imp. ipaûiliba, trans. nom. ailieb, a calling.
intend.
pinaior, papaior, aiorra, aiorren, inaiorren, inoaiorren, to precede any one, to shew the way; the way, aiorran, inaiorran, inoaiorran.
pinairas, papairas, airasû, ipairasa, to be stubborn in any thing, ipairas, inipairas, inoipairas, as pàsies, nom. airas, as asies.
trans. from meroos, which see.
pinais, papais, aisa, aisan, inaisan, inoaisan, to pester.
pi, pa, to whistle thro' the teeth.
pinûita, papûita, ipaita, to show; what? ipaita, inipaitû, inoipaita; to whom? aitanni, inaitanni, inoaitanni, trans. from Mita, which see.
pi, pa, bajussa, bajussen. binûjús, inobajûssen, to blow a gale, to storm. Pabajûs, trans. Bajûs, nom. a storm.

pinakaqûa, papakaqûa, aka-qua-a, akaqûa-an, inakaqûa, inoakaqûa-an, to do any thing moderately, alsoipakaqua-a, ipakaqua-a, ipakaqua, inipakaqûa, inoipakaqûa, nom. qûa, a little, moderate, akaqûa, diminution.
pinakaûkaû, papakaùkaû, akaûkaûa, akaûkaûan, inakaûkaûan, inoûkaûkaûan, to bawl out loud.
pi, pa, akeassa, akéassan, inakeas, inoakéassan, to stick out one leg behind, as kûmmitta.
pi, pa, ipakeassû, ipakeûs, inipakeûs, inoipakeas, to do as above, nam. akeûs, the sticking out of the leg.
pinakibokibo, papakibokibo, akibokiboa, to flutter, trans. from kummibokibo, which see.
pi, pa, akikkekikkea, to swarm, as pakikkekikke tsi. binnan.
pi, pa, imp. akkarótta, to crack. Pakarot, trans. nom. karot, cracked.

zh-def: 以搖動的方式讓鈴響被聽到
ori-def: pi, pa, imp. akillekillea, to rattle, but so as that a ringing is heard, as from money, or the rings on the arms. Differs from paseerseer.
pinakkio, papakkio, akkio, akkioa, the cry of deer.
pi, pa, akkolla, to dig deep.
pinakobos, papakobos, akobossa, akobossan, inakobossan, inoakobossan, to hunt with nets, also ipakobossa, ipakonos, inipakobos.
pi, pa, akotkótta, the cackling of hens.

(let the last letter be scarcely heard) pinala, papûla, ipûla, alûnni, inalanni, inoalanni, to say, to tell. Ala, nomen, a saying. This noun is compounded of karri, as karri ala, and mau, as mau ala, to converse together.
trans. from Malla, which see.
pinalablabg, papalûblabg, alablûbba, alablabban, inalûblabban, inoalablabban, to fan with a fan.
pinalachach, papalachach, alachacha, alachachen, inalachach, inoalachachen, the opposite of Padidden. See Malachach, of which this is the transitive.

zh-def: 使⋯⋯鬆脫；鬆鬆地放在一起
ori-def: means also to make any thing loose, to put loosely together; but then ipalachacha, ipalachach, inipalachach, inoipalachach.

zh-def: 把東西放成一直排或並排
ori-def: pinalalat, papalalat, balabalata, binalabalat, balalabalatten, iiiobalabalatten, to put things in a row, or side by side. Palalat ja se malam o bausies; it differs from Palat, see Pûlalat, pinûlalat, pûpalalat, ipalalatta, ipûlalat, inipûlalat, inoipalalat, to arrange in a row, add thereto, balûlat, the noun.
trans. from lûmmapilapies, of malapilapies, which see.

zh-def: 把東西放成一直排，但有涉及運送方面
ori-def: pinûlat, papûlat, balatta, balatten, binalat, inobalatten, as palûlat, except that palat, extends itself to the conveying, but taken transitively, ipalûtta, ipalat, inipalat, add thereto, balat, the noun.
pinalaûlaûb, papalaûlaûb, laûlaûba, laûlaûban, linaûlaûban, &c.
trans. from Mallakkûm
pallidóllido, pinallidóllido, papallidóllido, allidollidóa, allidollidoan, inallidollidóan, inoallidollidoan, to run backwards and forwards, spoken also of a crooked way, pallidollidoa taran.
pi, pa, allilla, pas. allillen, inallil, inoallillen, as maûchûs, matsipi, to roar and tear. Pallillil, intend. pallil.
trans. allil, a noise.

pi, pa, imp. ûlloa, to reach to, to reach any thing to any one, is also used for the giving of a pledge of marriage, as &c. as the Formosans are sometimes accustomed to do. Palo, trans. nom. allo, a reaching out, a pledge, which is given as a pledge of acon tract.

zh-def: 發現或是揭示〈某事〉給某人
ori-def: pinallossa, pûpallossa, allossa, allossanni, inallossanni, inoallossanni, to discover or reveal a little to any one.
pinalololullo, papalololullo, allolulloan, inalololulloan, inoalololulloan, to make a noise, as by the feet of those who tread hard, or as from a shower of rain; poeple say, palololullo ja oetas.

pinamamma, papûmamma, ûmamma, to cover a field with grass; what ? amammamanni and amammayan, inamammûnni and inamammayan, inoamammanni and inoammammayan, wherewith? ipàmamma, inipamamnia, inoipamamnia.
ameeûa, the mewing of cats.
pi‚ pa‚ amoggimoggia, amoggimoggien, inamoggimoggien, inoamoggimoggien, to murmur, to mumble. Amoggimoggi, a murmuring. Ma-amoggimoggi, a murmurer.

some whither, to some place, pana Baziekan, to Batsjekan, sometimes de is added, as pana de Taiwan, to Taiwan. It is also a verb, and has in the in praet. pinana, in fut. papûna, in imperat. ûna, act. ipana, trans.
pinan, pûpan, banna, bannan, binannan, inobannan, to stop up with earth. Pûban, pinaban, papaban, ipabanna, ipaban, inipaban, inoipaban, to do thus; baban, a dam.
pinannab, papannab, anabba, what ? annabben, inannab, inoannabben, where with ? ûnnaban, inannaban, inoannaban, the washing of the hands,
pinûnno, pananno; annoa, to dress one's self, what ? annoan, inûnnoan, inoannoan, wherewith ? ipanno, inipanno, inoipanno. Pano, trans.
pi, pa, the singing of musquitoes.
pinano, papano, to clothe another; what or who ? anoan, inamoan, inoanoan; wherewith ? ipûno, inipûno, inoipûno; see panno, a little above.
pinanokkonokko, papanokkonokko, annokkonokkoa, annokkonokkoan, or anni, or aijan, inanokkonokkoan, inoanokkonokkoan, to intreat. Annoggonoggo, an intreaty.
a-oa-oû-a, the cry of crows.

(the first a short, to distinguish it from Pû-oabi, to cause to sow;) pina-oabi, papa-óabi, a-óabia, a-óabi, inaoabi, to sow the fields; thus ûo-abian, inaoabian. Babósa, pa-oabi, the sower; adda ipa-oûbi, it is sown; Bonnaaoabian, it was sown. Aoûbi, a sowing. Aoûbian, aoabi aijan, the sowing season, or place.
pina-obo, papa-obo, a-obóa, a-ó-boan, inaóboan, inoa-óboan, to clue, to clue up, to draw up into a clue; also ipaóboa, ipa-obó, inipa-obo.
a pairing.
an oyster.
pinapapûdda, papapûdda, apapûdda, apapaddan, inipapaddan, inoipapaddan, to wash the feet, wherewith ? apapaddanni, or ayan, inapapaddanni, inoapapaddanni.
from Mûpappa, which see.
from Mapil, which see.
apillepillikka, to clap together, as two hands, two planks, &c.

pinûra, papara, arû, arûn, inara, inoaran, to be with any one, to accompany; araosse ta Cabba oe, does Cabba keep company? Ara, a comrade, pas. aran, inaran, to be accompanied: this passive is used with respect to those who attend on any one, as Takaba aran o Takalla, i.e. Takabba is waited on by Takala; or Takaba inara o icho, i. e. Takabba is attended by him; and aran, is also taken for the person who serves, that is the servant and maid.

pinarab, paparab, iparaba, to impregnate, to get with child: see rummab, the transitive of which this is, and means, to impregnate, or to cause a woman to be pregnant, while rummab, betokens the receiver. And raben, the child; rinab is received.

pinaraba, papûraba, ara, aran, inara, inoaran, from Para, to adopt as a child, also to give up for that purpose; in which case it is ipûraba-a, iparaba. Paraba, act. and trans. The child rûmmaka, takes another for his father. The real father lets the child be taken by another. Paraba choa, refers to those who take the child; it is also said Paraba, to take a child. An adopted father raba amosjiem. The real father iparabo. The child is called by the adopten father, aran.
pinarûllibal, paparûllibal, baralliballa, barûllibal, binarallibal, inobarallibal, to put out linen, &c. to dry. But has not such an extensive meaning as porra; pabarallibal, to do thus.
from rûmmapies, which see.
from mûrar, which see.
pinarid, papûrid, aridden, inarid, inoaridden, the place or part from whence, ariddan, inariddan, inoariddan, to dry up, activ. see Marid, neutr.
from Marara, which see.
from rûmmaût, which see.
from rûmmaûrat, which see.

zh-def: 嗆到〈以不正常的飲食方式才嗆到〉
ori-def: pinardosan, papardosan, to choke, as those do, who take the food or drink the wrong way. Paardosan, ipinaardosan, papaardosan, ipaardosana, &c. to do so.
pi, pa, imp. ûresshia, aresshi-in, inaresshi, inoaresshi-in, pas. iparesshi, to set up to fight, aresshi, nom. a setting on. Ma-aresshi, one who sets on.
pinûriaut, papûriaût, ariauta, ariaûtan, inariaut, inoariaut, to fill, to make full. Also to let fill, in which case ipariaûta, ipariaut, ariaut, nom.
as rûmmiggo, pinariggo, papariggo, ariggoa, ariggoan, inariggo, inoariggoan, ariggoan: see Mariggo.

pinatikoriko, paparikoriko, rikorikoa, rikorikoan, rinikorikoan, to share any thing, to wave it backwards and forwards, or let such be done, in which case it is iparikorikoa, iparikoriko, iniparikoriko, &c.
see rûmmikak.
pinario, papûrio, arióa, arióan, &c. to make good. Mario, arió, an improving, a making good.
pi, pa, imp. arrióriotta, from Parriot, to see below; is said of ivy, &c. which climbs up long sticks or trees, and embraces them.
a clear sky.

zh-def: 把手和腳放在彼此〈身上〉
ori-def: pi, pa, arokaila, pass. arokailen, inarokail, to lay the hands or feet over each other.
pinarne, paparne, iparnea, ipûrne as rûmne. Paûrne, see rûmmene.
aroba, pass. aroban, inaroban, inoaroban ja bonna, to strew, to spread out dry things.

pinarorro, paparrorro, arrorroa, arrorroan, as rûmmorro, to assemble. Parorro, pinarrorro, papûrorro, ipûrorroa, ipûrorro, iniparorro, inoiparorro, to do thus. Mind that it must be written Parorro, act. from Mûrorro.
pinarrar, paparrar, arrûrra, arrarran, inarrarran, inoarrarran, to hedge round, arrar, a hedge.
pinarrabarra, paparrabûrra, barrabarran, barrabarrûan, binarrabarraan, inobarrabarraan, naked, to make one's self naked.
pi, pa, iparracha, iparrach, to commit fornication. Shiem parrach, a bastard; rini pûrrach, a bee that is put in a wrong place outside the nest.

pinarras, paparras, bûrrasa, bûrrasan, binarrasan, to let go, to free, to put out of one's hand, to set down, in which case it is iparrasa, &c. Ma-ababarras, a redeemer. Ca Christus paga ma-ababarras o babosa, that is, Christ is the Saviour of mankind.
pinûrribrieb, to shake, arribrieba, all kinds of shaking.
trans. from Marri, which see.
pinûrried, paparried, arrida, arridan, inarridan, the superstitious use of old enchantments.
pinarrinon, paparrinon, arrinoa, to quarrel, to do that which cannot be named; rattirrien, idem.
pinarro, papûrro, barroa, bûrroan, binarro, to bundle up, to make up into bundle or sheaves. Pabarro, pinabarro, papabûrro,i pabûrroa, ipabarro, &c. to do thus. Barro, a sheaf.
pinarriot, paparriot, ariotta, ariottan, inarriottan, to wrap up, the same as rumniot, but from another root.
pi, pa, imp. arripieripia, pas. parripieri-in, pinarripieri-in, with a turn of the eye, to see anything dimly.
pinarriparri, inoparriparri, parriparria, parriparri-in, pinarriparri, inoparriparri-in, to bore a hole.
pi, pa, arripieripitta, pass. arripieripitten. inarripieripit, to cackle, to jabber. Paripieripit, trans. arripieripit, a prating, a babbling. Ma-arripieripit a babbler.
pinûrroa, papûrroa, arroa, arroan, inarroan, inoarroan, to dig out.
pinart, pûpart, arta, arten,inart, inoarten, to bruise or break any thing, as a reed, or such like.
pinûsaas, papûsaas, asaassen, inasaas, to occasion a looseness.

zh-def: 縫接，讓各端重疊在一起
ori-def: pi, pa, asappa, ipasap, inipasûp, to seam, so that the ends lap over each other. Asap, nom. Trans. pasap.
trans. from Sûmmaso, which see.
trans. from Masear, which see.
pi, pa, asasa, ipasasa, to carry on the head or on the neck, as an ox, the yoke, also to carry on the shoulders. Asasan, the place where men carry any thing; asasaù, the yoke which the ox bears.
pinûsassar, ipasassara, ipasassar, inipasassar, inoipasassar, to whistle or say any thing softly, see Passassar.
pinabas, papûsbas, basbassa, basbassen, binasbas, inobasbassen, to bite flat, to gnaw even.
pi, pa, imp. aseerseer, to rattle without noise. See Pakillekille.
pinûshadda, papûshadda, ipashadda, inipûshadda, inoipashadda, to put a roof on the house.
pi, pa, asia, asian, inasian, inoasian, ipasi, pass, ipasi, inipasi, inoipûsi, to shell. Asi, a peeling.
pi, pa, imp. ashimda, pass. ashimdan, to stroke with the hand.
pinasinok, papasinok, ipasinokka, ipûsinok, inipasinok, inoipasinok, to blow the nose; see Passinok.

pinûshemar, papûshemar, ashemûrra, ashemûrran, inashemarran, inoashemarran, to smear, to rub over; wherewith ? ipashemar, inipaahemar, inoipasjemar, to let the same be done, in which case it is ipashemarra, ipashemar, &c. as above. Sashemar, fat.
fiery, courageous, pasies o ramied, bold in words, to boast, to vaunt. Pasies o mababat, proud in one's gait. Asies, nom, lofty. Ma-asies, one who is bold.
piasiet, papûsiet, having taken cold, to cough. Asiet, a cough.

pinashir, papasshir, isshirra, to put anything down or in. Pashir, trans. nom. sashir, the putting any thing down, sûshiran, or sashirayan, the place where men put anything down. Sûshiran o tûttullo, contracted, sashiran tûttûllo, a trader.
to pass along. Pashi abas, along the sea shore. Móso, ditto.
pinsiansin, papasinsin, the head-ache.
pi, pa, asshipirra, to sprinkle with water, same as babichi; ashipir, nom. subst, a sprinkling.

pinasiksik, papasiksik, asiksikka, asiksikken, inasiksik, inoasiksikken, as pûdidden; in this form it is active, so also mûsisisik, but imp. ipasiksikka, pass. ipasiksik, inipasiksik, inoipasiksik; from sûmmiksik.
pinàsisiet, papûsisiet, asisita, asisiten, inasisiet, inoasisiten, to cool any food that is hot, also to let cool; in which case it is ipasisita, ipasisiet.
and Pasissississese, to rattle, as a broken gong, the bell &c.
pinasoa, papasoa, asoû, ûsoan, inûsoa, inoasoan, or soan, sinoan, to wound, to cause to be wounded, in which case it is ipûsoa, inipasoa.
pinasobi, papasibo, ipasobia, ipasobi, inipasobi, inoipasobi, to strew and sprinkle with any thing dry, as salt, sand, &c.
pinasoeisoei, papasoeisoei, asoeisoeia, to whistle with the mouth.
pinûsoes, papûsoes, ipûsoesa, ipasoes, inipasoes, inoipûsoes, to cause to hear. Pabûsoes, pinabûsoes, papabasoes, ipapûssoesa, ipûpassoes, inipapassoes, inoipapassoes, ditto.
see under passos.

zh-def: 使兩個原本應連接但卻分離的東西相連
ori-def: p, pa, imp, asorra, pass. ipasorra, to join together two things that are separated from each other, and which ought to be united, as two houses, two letters, &c.
pinasosot, papasosot, asosota, asosotan, inasosotan, inoasosotan, to deal out, to distribute, what ? asosoten, inûsosoot, inoasosoten, or ipûsosot.
pi, pa, paspûssa, paspûssen, pinaspûssen, inopaspûssen, to rain gently. Paaspas, trans. Paspas, nom. a muzzling rain.
pinûssabo, papûssabo, assabóa, assabon, inassabo, inoassabon, to carry anything between two. Pasabo, pinâsabo, papasabo, ipûsaboa, ipûsabo, inipasabo, inoipasabo, to do thus.
pinassapa, papassapa, to lisp.
pinassassar, papassassar, assassûrra, assassûrran, inassassarran, inoassassarran, to whisper.
pinasshadda, papasshadda, to cover a house, what ? asshadda, asshaddanni. inassiaddanni, wherewith ? ipashaddan, sipashadda, &c.
pinûssinok, papûssinok, assinokka, assinokkan, to blow the nose.
pinûssobi, papûssobi, assobia, assobian, inassobian, inoassóbian, to strew with anything dry, as salt, &c.
pinasso, papûsso, bassoa, bassoan, binassoan, inobassoan, to make a string of bamboo.

pinassopietpiet, papassopietpiet, assopietpieta, assopietpietan, inassopietpietan, inoassopietpietan, to seam. Pasopietpiet, pi, pa, ipasopietpieta, ipasopietpiet, inopasopiepiet, inoipasopietpiet, to cause to be hemmed.
a bore. Passos, pi, pa, pûssossa, passosan, pinassosan, to bore.

pi, pa, assopirra, assopirran, inassopirran, inoassopirran, to fish with a cast net. Pasopir, pi, pa, ipasopirra, ipasopir, to fish thus. Assopir, such fishing; also the instrument employed, a cast net.
pi, pa, bassosa, bassosan, binûssosan, inobassosan, to kiss. Pabassos, pi, pa, ipabûssosa, ipabassos, inipabassos. Babûssos, a kiss, nom.

pinûssoso, papûssoso, assosoa, to whom ? assosoan, inassosoûn, inoassosoan, to give, to present, to give for nothing: what ? ipassos, inipassoso, inoipassoso, ditto. Passok, pi, pa, imp. assokka, from whence seems to be derived the name of the village Assok, which is the noun, from the verb passok, meaning a gift; because the site of the village Assok was formerly given to the inhabitants of Tamachan. Psaoso, trans. a gift.
pinûtach, papûtach, ipûtacha, ipatach, inipûtach, inoipatach, to make the teeth black. See pattach.

pinûtapa, papûtapa, to let anything fall down from above, what ? ipûtapa, ipatapa, inipatapa, inoipatapa, on whom ? atapa-a, atapa-an, inatûpa-an, inoatapaûn; also to do thus, in which case it is ipatapa, &c.
pinàtippo, papatippo, atippoa, atippoan, inatippóan, inoatippoan, to shoot with a musket, or to cause to shoot, in which case it is inoatippoa, ipatippo, inipatippo, inoipatippo.
pinatis, papatis, ipatissa, ipatia, inipatis, inoipatis, to throw away or lose, trans. from Matis, which see.
pi, pa, atoamma, atoamman, &c. to let dogs play together.
pi, pa, papatta-arion, to put any thing behind. See Matarron.

zh-def: 把...放在另一個東西上面
ori-def: pi, pa, assikasarra, to lay one over the other.
pi, pa, atsikirra, the singing of the larks, nom. tsikir.
pinattach, papattach, attacha, attachan, to blacken the teeth.
as Paggai.
the chattering of sparrows.
pinattadach, papattadach, atadacha, atadachen, to warm. Patadach, pi, pa, ipatadacha, ipatadach, inipatadach, to make warm.
is never used alone, but Mau patala, stepfather; Naij patala, stepmother; Shiem patala, stepson; Atoasa patala, stepbrother, or stepsister.

pinattallaijach, papattallaijach, attallaijacha, attallaijachan, inattallaijachen, to lie on one's back. Patallaijach, pinattallaijach, papatallaijach, ipatallaijach, ipatallaijacha, to put on the back.

pinattallakkum, papatallakkum, atallakkumma, inatallakkumman, inoatallakkumman, as Pallakkum. But patallakkûm, pinatallakkûm, papatallakkum, ipatallakkumma, ipatallakkûm, inipatallakkûm, inoipatallkkûm, as palakkum.
pinattap, papattap, attappa, attappen, inattappan, inoattappan, to up a hole or rent, either with patching, darning, or plaiting.
pinattapa, papattapa, to fall, to fall down, as the drops of water from the roof; hence attapa-an, inatapa-an, inoatapa-an, to cause to fall; patapa; hence attapa, nom. a drop.
pinattarran, papattarran, atarrana, atarranen, inatarran, inoatarrannen, to get out of the way, to make room. To cause that such be done. Patarran, pinatarran, papatarran, ipatarrana, ipatarran, &c.
from Matarrigi, which see.
pinattas, papattas, atassa, atassen, inattassan, inoattassan, to paint, to write. Patas, pinatas, papattas, ipatassa, ipatas, to cause to be written or painted.

pinattaulieb, papattaûlieb, ataûliba, ataûliban, inataûliban, inoataûliban, to hold any thing behind or under one. PataûlieB, pinataûlieb, papataûlieb. ipataûliba, ipataûlieb, inipataûlieb, to shelter any one.
pinattaûso, papattaûso, ataûsoa, ataûsoan, inataûso, to heal. Pataûso, pinataûso, papataûso, ipataûsoa, ipataûso, to cause to be healed.
pinatto, the tingling in the ears.
pinattaûte, papattaûte, attaûtea, attaûtin, inataûte, inoatautin, unexpectedly to take fire. Pataute, pinataûte, papataûte, ipataûtea, ipataûte, inipataûte, inoipataûte, to do thus.

pinattazies, papattazìes, attazisa, to make a scare crow, pass. ipattazìes, inipattazies, inoipatazies, that of which a scare crow is made. Also to set up a scare crow, in which case it is attazisan, inattazisan, inoattaziaan. Patazies, pi, pa, ipatazies, ipatazisa, inipatazies, to do thus.

pinattil, papattil, ipattilla, attilla, ipattil, attillan, inipattil, inattillan, inoipattil, inoatillan, to learn, to give lesson, activ. Patil, pinattil, papatil, ipatilla, to learn; neutral. &c. this has no participle. Thus people say, Cho attillan, the peole are taught; attite o Deos ipattil, the word of God is taught.

pinattillo, papatillo, ipattilloa,
arrilloa, ipattillo, *attilloan,
*inipattillo, inattilloan, inoipattillo,
inoattilloan, to command, to order.
*l'atillo, pinatillo, papatillo, &c.
to cause to command;
attilloan ja cho, the people are commanded;
ipatillo ja *rauied, the order is given.

pinattite, papattite, attitea, attitean.
inattitean, *inoattitean, 
to speak openly to the people, to preach.
Patite, pi, pa, ipatitea, ipatite, inipatite, inoipatite,
to do thus.

pinattodoch, *papattodoch, attodocha, attodochen,
inattodoch, inoattodochen, to buy.
*Patodoch, pinatodoch, papatodoch, ipatodocha,
ipatodoch, *inipatadoch, &c. to let buy.

pinattodon, papattodon, *attodonua, *attoddounan,
inattodonnan, inoattodounan, to dwell, to inhabit.
Patodon, pi, pa, ipatodonna, ipatodon, *iniputodon,
to cause to dwell.

pinattokar, papattokar, attokarra, attokarran,
inattokarran, *inoattokarran, to fix a mast in a vessel.
Patokar, pi, pa, &c. *Ipatokarran, ipatokar,
inipatokar, to do so. Attokar, a mast.

pi, pa, atokka, to be still.
Pattok, pi, pa, ipatokka, ipatok, inipatok, inoipatok,
to make still, or to still.

pinattonan, papattonan, attonanna, attonannan,
inattonannan, to name.
Pûtonan, pin, pan, ipatonanna, ipetonan, &c.
to cause to be named.

zh-def: 搭帳篷〈在打獵或捕魚時可以放行囊的地方〉
ori-def:
pi, pa attorrobocha, attorrobochen, inattorroboch,
inoattorobóchen, to have a camp, or place of meeting
abroad in the field, when men go to hunt, fish, &c. 
where they can stow away the baggage.
Patorroboch, trans. roboch, nom. 
baggage which people take with them to the hunt.

to beget, to generate, generally betokens the taking up,
the accounting, or the taking up of an affair.
*au paûbaddoa, paû alle, also paû sjiem, to take any
one for baddoa, alle, or shiem, (i.e. child) This paû is
compounded with verbs as well as nouns. See below.
trans. from Maûaat, which see.

pinaûab, papaûab, *ipaûaba, ipaûab, inipaûab,
to cause to increase, to enlarge, from Moab, which see.

pinauba, papauba, ipaûba, inipaûba, inoipauba, to drive 
away sleep, to wake anyone out of sleep.

those who are born on the same dat call each other baddoa; to take one 
for such is paubaddoa, piûnabaddoa, papaûbaddoa, 
aûbaddoa, aûbaddoan, inaubaddoa, inoaubaddoa; paaûbaddoa, 
pinaaûbaddoa, papaaûbaddoa, ipûaûbaddoa, inopaaûbaddoa.

zh-def: 把某物當作自己的所有物或財產
ori-def:
pi, pa , aûballûg-a, to take anything for own's property. 
Paauballag, to do so.

pinaûchar, papaûchar, aûchûrra, aucharran, inaûcharran, inoaûchûrran,
to breathe. Paûûchar, pi, pa, ippaûcharra, ipaaûchar, inipaaûchar,
to do so. Hence char, the breath, also aûchar, the Spirit.
oh you lacquey, you poor fellow!

pi, pa, auchodónna, to take any one for one's relation. Paaûchodon,
to do so.

zh-def: 完成工作；停下工作；用某工具或某物用得夠久
ori-def:
pinaûchús, papaùchûs, aûchûssa, aûchûssen, inaûchus, inoauchussen, 
to finish any work, to leave off. Also to have used any instrument or
thing long enough. In which case it is auchussan, inauchussan, 
innauchussan. Paaûchûs, pi, pa, ipaaûchussa, ipaaûchus, inipaaûchus,
to cause or let leave off. &c. See Maûchus

pi, pa, auakakossia, pas. aûakakossi-in, &c. 
to account any one disobedient.

zh-def: 認為某人貞潔的、有道德的
ori-def: pau-machimit, aûachimta, aûabissea. Pau-marapies, paumario, &c. all of which formed in the same manner.

zh-def: 把某人的家認作自己的家
ori-def:
pi, pa, audonna, audonnao, inaûdon, inoaûdonnan, to account one's
house one's own. Paaûdon, trans.

pi, pa, aûcha, pass. to blow or snort through the nose, 
as the oxen, &c. from rage. Aûch, the blowing.
pi, pa, aûkamaina, to account any one a relation by marriage.

pi, pa, aûkakossia, to account any one disobedient. Paaûkakossi,
to do so.

pi, pa, aulalluma, to dig deep, as if it were said, to make deep. See above.
Paollûllum, see molalum.
pi, pa, aurapisa, to account or consider anything bad.
pi, pa, aurio-a, to account or consider anything good.

zh-def: 把某事〈拍、捶〉打得小或細
ori-def: see Maûpi, of which this is the transitive.
see Morrod, ditto.

pinaúre, pàpaure, aûrea, aûrin, inaure, inoaurin, to make slices of flesh 
or fish. Paaûre, pinaaure, papaaure, ipaaurea, ipaaûre, inipaaûre,
inoipaaure, to do thus. Re, dried flesh or fish.

pinaûrtatach, papaûrtatach, ipaûrtatach-a, ipaurtatach-a, ipaurtatach, 
inipaurtatach, inoipaurtatach, to scatter. act. paaûrtatach, pinaaûrtatach,
papaaurtatach, pa. ipaaurtatacha, ipaaurtatach, inipaaurtatach, 
inoipaaurtatach, to cause to be scatterd, trans, front Mortatach.

pinaûros, papauros, aurosa, aurossen, inauros, inoaurossen, to take any
one for one's consort. Paaûros, pi, pa, ipaaurosa, ipaauros, &c. to cause
any one to be taken for one's consort.

pinauloan, papauloan, aûloanna, aûloannen, inaûloan, inoauloannen,
to make any one for a labourer or slave. Also to do thus, in which case
it is ipadloanna, ipauloan, inipaûloan, inoipaûloan. Loan, victuals, a slave,
also a quadruped. But whenever this word is used for a slave, it is always
employed in a bad sense.

pinaûrus, papaurûs, aurussa, aurussar, inaurussan, inoaurusaan, to cool,
to refresh. Paaurus, pi, pa, ipaaurûssa, ipaaurus, to do so; trans.
from Morus, which see.

pinaûsà, papausû, ipaûsà, inipaûsa, inoipausa, to give permission to go,
also to order to depart. Really to let go, i. e. to order to go. Paausa, pi, pa,
to do so, trans. from Mossa.

pinausa-o, papausa-o, ausa-o-a, ausaoon, inausa-o, inoausa-oon, 
to embrace with one arm. Paausa-o, pi, pa, ipaausa-oa, ipaausao, &c.
to do so.
trans. either from Mausi, or Posi, which see.
pi, pa, aûshima, aûshimen, &c. to generate, also to acknowledge any one as one's child.
and pautanaîj, pi, pa.

zh-def: 標示某物〈以區分自己的所有物或財產〉
ori-def:
pi, pa, autûtta, autattan, inaûtattan, inoautattan, to mark anything, in order
to distinguish it from another's property. Pûautat, nom. a mark.

zh-def: 使非常相似的事物改變〈以至於人們很容易將它誤認為另一種，有意圖的欺騙〉
ori-def: trans. from Tummaroggi.
pi, pa, to imitate, to ape.

pinaz-ipat, papaz-ipat, bazibadda, baz-ibadden, binaz-ibat, i
nobaz-ibadden, to make level, to make even. Paaz-ipat, pi, pa, 
ipabaaz-ibadden, or ipaaz-ibadda, ipabaaz-ibadden, or ipaasipat, 
inipabaaz-ibad, or inipaaz-ipat, &c. Bazibat, eveness.

pinazikakapol. papazikakapol, azikakápolla. azikakapollan,
inazikakápollan, to run in the way, also to do so, in which case it is 
ipazikakápolla, ipazikakápol, &c.

pinazinado, papazinado, azinadoa, azinadon, inazinado, inoazinadon,
to interpret. Pazinado tarran, to show the way. Paazinado, pi, pa,
ipaazinadoa, ipaazinado, inipaazinado, to cause to interpret, &c. 
Tummacho, ditto. Patacho, or pitto, ditto. nom. tattach-o, in the verb trans.
and noun, used with kar and mau, as kar tattacho, mau tattacho. Azinado,
an interpretation. Ma-azinado, an interpreter.

pi, pa, azioa, pass. azioan, inazióan, inoazioan, to stamp with the feet on
the ground. Paazio, trans. Azio, nom. subst. Maazió, a stamper.

pi, pa, azioessanna, azioessannan, inazioessan, inoazioessannan, to
have the hickup. Paazioessan, trans. azioessan, nom. the hickup.

pinaziogga, papaziogga, aziogga, azioggan, also anni, and aijan, 
inazioggan, inoazioggan, to put on an under garment. Paaziogga, pi, pa,
ipaaziogga, &c. to do so. Ogga, an under garment.

pinazipo, papazipo, azipoa, azipoon, inazipoon, inoazipoan, the washing 
of the face. Paazipo, pi, pa, ipaazipoa, ipaazipo, inipaazipo, &c.
the morning, from sun rise to half midday.

pienchab, pabchab, bchabba. bchábban, bienchabban, to cover one's
self with a wrapper. To cover one's self. See Pabechab.

pineam papea, ipea, ipe-a, inipea, inoipea, to give; changed into ea, ean,
inean, &c. it means to be presented. Paya, pinaya, papaya, ipaya, inipaya,
 inoipaya, to cause to be given; this is written Paia, pi, pa, to distinguish it
from Paija, to lean backwards. Aija, a gift. Ma-aija, a giver.

forms into tpea, as Pea, to prepare and dish up food and drink; in order to
treat anyone.

pinébe, papébe, bebéa, bebeén, binébe, inobebéen, bebea, to dissuade.
Pabebe, pi, pa, ipabebe. to do thus.

pinebé, papebé, ebéa, ebéan, inebéan, inoebéan, as pedarra. Paibe, pi, pa,
ipáibea. Aibe, nom. Aibe o rarobo, dough, i.e. flour mixed with water.

pinechab, papechab, echábba, echabban, inechabban, inoechábban,
to murder secretly. Paichab, pi, pa, ipaichábba, ipaichab, &c. to fo thus.

pi, pa, edarra, edarran, inedárran, inoedarran, when different things are
mixed together, as machoraáb. Aidarra; original substance with which 
anything is mixed, is edarran. Two different things, pedárra. A man, paidárra.
pi, pa, e-eoa, to dangle. Pai-eo, trans. E-eo, one who swings.

pi, pa, eesá, pass. eesán, ineesan, inoeesan, to file; Paees, trans. Aees, a
file; also steel, because they file with things in which there is much steel.
pi, pa, e-ella, e-ellan, ine-ellan, ince-ellan, to acknowledge.

pineroa, paperoa, éroa, eroan, ineroa, inoeroan, in two parts. Pairoa, pinairoa,
papairoa, ipairoa, inipairoa, inoipairoa, to divide into two parts.

pinesasa, papesasa, esasá, esásan, inesasa, inoesasan, to begin. Paisasa, pi, 
pa, ipaísasa, ípaisasa, &c. to be first to begin. Tackalla ja pesása ûmmop
tûmmaapo bonna Tabaipaû ja rior. Tackalla has finished his field before Tabaipau.
Aisasa, a beginning.

pinesasorri, inesasorrian, inoesasorrian, to change similar things, but knowingly
and on purpose, thus differing from Paûtatarrogi. Páisasorri, pi, pa, ipáisasorria,
ipaisasorri, &c. thus to change.
pi, pa, pesikkan, pass. pesikken, pinesikken, to break in pieces.

zh-def: 描述一個枝上結出兩個果實的狀態；或是樹根分叉〈為二〉的狀態
ori-def: pi, pa, pesilla, pesillen, pinesillen, inopesillen, is said of two fruits on one stalk, or when one root divides into two. Paisil, trans

pinesor, papesor, esorra, esorrán, inesorranm, inoesorran, to mean, to imagine,
to suspect. Paisor, pinaisor, papaisor, ipaisorra, ipaisor, inipaisor, inoipaisor,
to imagine in general.

pinespattil, papespattil, espattilla, espattillen, inespattil. inoespattillen, to divide
into four. Paispattil, pi, pa, ipaispattilla, ipaispattil, inipaispattil, inoipaispattil,
to do so.

pinetam, papetam, etamma, etamman, inetamman, inoetamman, to lean upon
the hand. Paietam, (to be distinguished from Paitam, to borrow,) pi, pa, 
ipaietûmma, &c. to do so.

pinetórro, papetórro, etorroa, etorroan, inetorroan, inoetórroan, to divided into 
three. Paitorro, pinaitorro, papaitorro, ipaitorroa, &c. to do so.

pinetûmmo, papetummo, epetûmmoa, epetummo, inipetummo, inoipetummo,
to spit upon. When it is also etûmmoa, etummoan, inetummoan, inoetummoan.
Paitummo, pinaitummo, papaitummo, ipaitummoa, ipaitummo, &c. to do so.

(with an aspirate, not as fon,) the insects which eat out, and render hollow 
the bamboos.
now; piada sisiá, to day.

pinia, papia, bia, bian, binia, inobian, to drive away the wild animals, such as
hogs, and stags, who come and devour the fields. Babia, the nouns.

piniách, pápiach, biácha, biachen, biniach, inobiachen, to separate fighters. 
Pabiach, pinabiach, pápábiach, ipábiacha, ipábiach, &c. to set apart.

pinian, popian, biárra, biárren, biniar, inobiarren, to pull out. Piar o bar, to lift up
the arm. to strike. Pábiar, pinabiar. pa. ipábiarra, ipabiar, inipabiar, inoipabiar,
to reach out.
an ape, a monkey.

pinido, papido, bídoa, bídoan, binidoan, inobidoan. to write. Pabido, pinábido,
papábido, ipábido, inipábido, inoipábido, &c. dit to. Bido, nom. a book, a writing. 
Babido, a writing, instruments for ditto.

zh-def: 鬆開〈彎曲的〉某物；把某物弄成棍狀
ori-def:
(let the first i be scarcely heard) pinichir, papichir, bechirra, bechirren, binechir, 
inobechirren, to let go anything that is bent. Also to push away any thing into a
stick. People say also Pichir o chacháap, to haul up a scoop net: pabichir, pi, pa,
ipabichirra, ipabichir, inipabichir, inoipabichir, ditto.

zh-def: 磨去或擦去指間的某物
ori-def:
piniepied, papiedpied, biedbida, biedbiden, biniedbied, inobiedbiden, to rub away
anything between the fingers. Pabiedoied, pinabiedbied, papabiedbied, 
ipabiedbida, &c. ditto.

piniéd, papied, bida, bidan, binidan, inobidan, to girdle. Pábied, pinabied, 
papábied, ipabida, ipabied, &c. to do so. Babied. a girdle. Babied an aijan, the 
place for the girdle.

zh-def: 放某物在兩個東西之間
ori-def: pi, pa, igcharrá, pass. igcharran, &c. same as pigchilla. Chárra, lattice work.
bent.

pinigeno, papigeno, to skim; gabigeno, pinabigeno, papabigeno, ipabigenoa, 
ipabigeno, &c. to do so.

zh-def: 放某物在兩個東西之間
ori-def:
pi, pa, igchilla, pass. igchillán, &c. to put one thing between two others, where
it does not adhere, but where it has room. Pichchárra, ditto. Paigchilla, trans. nom.
aigchilla, the doing so. Chilla, lattice work.

pinila2, papila, ilá, dán, inila, inoflan, to hit, to touch. Paila. Pinaila, papaila, &c.
to touch. Thus people say, pila ja áúbo, the fish have got into the right basket, 
whenever there are fish therein. Aila, nom. a hitting.

pinilla, papilla, billa, billaan, binilla, inobillaan, to cleave, to split. Babilla, pinabilla,
pa2pabilla, ipabullá, &c. ditto. Babilla, a cleaving. Billa, a cleft from Malilla, anything
to split with. Ma-ababilla, cleaver.

pinillála, pi, pa, &c. to split frequently. Pabillabilla, &c. increases the sense. 
Pabilla, ditto.

pinillibilli, papillibilli, billibilia, billibdien, hinillibilli, inobilliblien, binillibilli, inobilliblien.
to turn around, act. to twist. Pabillibilli, &c. to cause to be twisted. Pillibilli o saris o
aroot, thread, &c.

zh-def: 使自己處於易做某事的姿勢〈如拉頭髮、跑步、工作〉
ori-def:
pinilliech, seems to mean to put one's body in a position to do any
thing important. Pilliech o maûadet, o makarrieb,o tûmmaap, &c. to put one's
self in a posture to pull out hair, to run, or to work. Pabilliech ditto.

intend. pillepillik, pi, pa, billika, billikken, binillik, inobillikken, to press or join anything
underneath, (not between) as summiet. Pábillik, trans. babillik, nom. a pressing, also
that which people lay on a thing to press it down.

pinióp, papióp, ioppa, &c. to blow up. Piop o chau, to blow the fire. Piop o tabillo, 
to blow up or in. Piop o tattallo, to blow out. Paiop, pi, pa, ipaioppa, ipaiop, &c. to do so.

pinior, papior, ipiórra, what? ipior, inipior, inoipior, to leave behind; to whom? biorran, 
bioiorrán, inobiorrán. Pábior, pi, pa, ipábiorra, ipábior, inipábior, inoipábior, to do so.
Bior, a remainder, is also used as preposition.

piniri, papiri, iria, irian, inirian, inoirian, to search out, to choose, to reject, pairi, pináiri,
ipairia, ipairi, to do so.

pi, pa, birbirra, birbirren, binirbir, inobirbirren, the blowing about of the flame of a fire or 
candle.

zh-def: 除草〈專指街上或房子四周的雜草〉
ori-def:
irraba, irraban, &c. to weed, to pull up the weeds or grass out of the streets or places 
near the houses. But to weed fields is ummo-o; nevertheless this difference exists
between the two, that Pirraba is used when people gather the weeds from amongst the
good seed, but ummo-o when people pull up weeds out of a field, where no no good seed
has been sown.

pinirras, papirras, pirrassa, pirrássen, pinirras, inopirrassen, to tear, act. Papirras, 
pinapirras, papápirras, ipapirrassa, ipapirras, &c. to do so.
(the i barely heard) the barley that is used in brewing liquor.

(the i barely heard) pineries, papirris, iperisa, iperies, iniperies, iperies, to close, to button up.
bries, trans. Babries, nom. a button.

(the i barely heard) pinirroos, papirroos, birroossa, birroossen, biroos, inobirroossen, 
to pull in from behind, to let go by. Pabirroos, pi, pa, ipabirroossa, ipabirroos, inipabirroos,
inoipabirroos, to let go by.

pinisbis, papisbis, bisbissa, bissen, binisbis, mobisbissen, to hold fast. Pabisbis, pi, pa,
ipabisbissa, ipabisbis, inipabisbis, inoipabisbis, ditto.

pinisor, papisor, isorra, isoninisor, inoisorren, to set on. Pis chau, to set on fire. Pisor o tazi, 
send up a kite. Paisor, pinai, papaisor, ipaisorra, ipaisor, inipai, inoipaisor, to cause to set on.

Pinissárra, papissárra, issárran, inissarra, inoissarran, to get in to company. Páisarra, 
pinaisarra, papáisarra, ipaisarra, inipaisarra, inoipaisarra, ditto. Aissarra, an accompanying.
Ma-aissárra, a companion . Sarra, a lineal succession, where chiledren and grand-children
follow each other. See below

pi, pa, &c. when many follow one after the other, in the manner of the natives. Paissarrasarra,
pi, pa, &c. to csuse this to be done.

pinisse, papisse, bissea, bissein, binisse, inobissein, to rectify. Pábisse, pinábisse, papábisse,
ipábissea, ipábisse, &c. to cause to be rectified. Nom. Bisse, justice, righteousnesss. Babisse,
rectitude, from Pisse. Abisse, a justifying; act. Passese; intentd. Pisse; nom. Bisse.

piensillo, papisaillo, bissilloa, bissilloan, biensillo, inobissilloon, to wrap up anything in order to
take care of it, as, silk, money, tabacco, &c. Pábissillo, pi, pa, ipábissilloa, ipabissillo, &c.
to cause to be done.

(let the i be scarcely heard) pienso, pápisso, bissoá, bissoan, inobissoan, &c. to draw out, as
people do in drawing lots, and all kinds of drawing. Pábisso, pi, pa, ipábissoa, to cause to be 
drawn. Babisso, a drawing; this noun compunded with mau or karri signifies lots, 
because such are made by the drawing out of tickets. Maababisso, a drawer.

zh-def: 快速闔上手掌；以手壓某物
ori-def:
piensir, papissir, pissirren, piensir inopiensirren, to close the hand fast, to press anything with
the hand. Papissir, pinapissir. papápissir, ipápissirra, ipapissir, inipapissir, inoipápissir, to cause
the ahnd to be closed.

pinitítil, papititil, bietbitilla, bietbitillen, to break, cut, or slice a thing into small pieces; but is often
used of things that are long, and _____ (which?) by many transverse sections may made
smaller, as a bamboo. a fish plantain, &c. Paititil, pi, pa, ipaititilla, to cause this to be done.

zh-def: 把動物的後腿切成兩半；把某物切成兩半
ori-def:
pi, pa, pittassa, pittassen, pitássen, inopittassen, to cut the hind legs of an animal in two, or
sever anything in two.

zh-def: 在某人旁邊〈跟他一起〉做某事〈如走路、站著、躺著、坐著〉
ori-def:
pinittassir, papittassir, ittassirra, ittassirran, inittassirran, inoittassirran, to do anything by the side
of another, as walking, standing, lying, sitting, &c. Paitassir, pinaitassir, paitassir, ipaitassirra,
ipaitassir, to cause the above to be done.

zh-def: 把東西放成一直排或並排
ori-def:
pinittas-tassir, papittas-ttas-tassira, ittas-tassirran, as palalat. Paitastassir, pi, pa, ipaitas-tassirra,
ipaitas-tassir, to do thus.
pinittatik, papittatik, bittebittikka, bittebittikken, bientibbittik, inobittebittikken, the multiplication of Pittik.
pi, pa, imp. ittaûa, to believe.  Aittaûa, belief. Ma-aittaû, a believer.

zh-def: 講話的停頓〈當某人已經說完一個主題時〉；休息
ori-def:
pinittik, papittik, bittikka, bittikken, bientik, inobittikken, a pause in speaking when people 
have  finished a subject . Also to rest one's self, from all kinds of work, in order afterwards to work with
new strength. pinitik, pinibittik, papábittik, ipábittikka, ipabittik, to cause to pause. pi, pa, bittoa, 
same as pazinado.
pi, pa, bittoa, same as pazinado, nom. babitto, as azinado.

zh-def: 不提及某事一陣子；永遠不提及某事
ori-def:
pinittol, papittol, ittollaen, ittóllia, ittollen or anai or aijan, initollan, inoittollan, to let anything alone,
either for awhile from a belief that it can be set aisde for the present; or to let it alone entirely, from despair of ever being able to reach the end. Páittol, pinaittol, papáittol, ipaittolla,
&c. to cause this to be done.

an expression by which it is meant that we are constrained to do something. Na a pizio. 
summarada, pizio na a man, na a pizi o merieo o bido. Pinizi, papizi, imp. Paizi, pinaizi. inipaizi,
&c. to require any one to do anything, trans. izia, ipizia, pas, izian, &c.

zh-def: 領導；帶領某人去〈打架、奔跑、吃飯〉
ori-def:
pinizich, papizich, bizicha, bizichen, binizich, inobizichen, to direct; pizich o pach a, o mabarieb,
o man, to lead on any one to fight, to run, to eat, &c. Pábizich, pi, pa, ipábizicha, ipábizich, 
o cause such to be done. Babizich, nom. a leading on. Ma-ababizich, a leader.

papo-poa, the cry and song of birds. Pábo, pinabo, papabo, ipaboa, ipabo, inipabo, inoipabo,
to cause the birds to cry. Po, signifies also the cry of rats, mice, snakes, &c. Bábo, nom.

pinoa, papoa, imp. boa, to bring forth fruit. Páboa, pinaboa, papaboa, ipaboá, &c. to cause to
bear fruit. Boa, nom. fruit, seed; person, flesh. Ma-ababoa, fruitful. Ma-ababoa o baron, a fruitful 
tree. But Poa, pi, pa, poá, pas. poán, pinoa, inopoan, to dye. Papoa, tans. papoa, nom the dying, 
and dye-stuff.

pinoach, papoach, o-ach-a, oachen, inoach, ino-achen, to forget. Paûach, pinaûach, papauach,
ipauacha, ipauach, &c. to cause to forget. Aûach, nom. a forgetting. Ma-auach, one who forgets.

zh-def: 製作蜂蜜；咀嚼米飯或大麥；準備〈用來釀烈酒的〉唾沫
ori-def:
pinó-ar, pápo-ar, bo-arra, bo-ar-ran. binoar, inoboarren, to make honey, also to chew rice or
barley, and to prepare the spittle wherewith strong drink is made. Paboar,  pináboar, papabóar,
ipabóara, ipáboar, &c. Baboa, nom. some spittle, from Massjekaû.

pinóas, papóas, boasa, bóasin, binóas, inoboasin, to rob, to lay waste, to destroy. Páboas, pi,
pa, ipaböasa, ipáboas, &c. to cause to lay waste.
obasa, to set up a flag or vane; obáas, a flag which the young men stick on their heads.

pinoberies, papoberies, oberisa, oberisen, onoberies, ino-oberisen. to take leave, or to bid 
farewell; those who take leave say, kamossa ma: and those who bid farewell say, sasa;
páûberies, pinaûberies, papáûberies, ipauberisa, inipaûberies, to cause to take leave.
Aûberies. nom.

pinóbo, papóbe, boboa, boboan, binoboan, inoboboan, to sift, to let any thing pass through a
sieve whether wet or dry. Pabobo, pinábobo, papáboba, ipaboboa, ipabobo, to cause this to be
done. Moparraparra, idem. Bábobo, nom. a sieve, a sifting.
pinoch, papóch, bocha, bochen, binoch, inobochen. to shoot. Páboch, pináboch, papaboch, ipaboch, inipaboch, inoipaboch.
pinocharráddan, papocharraddan, to have the cramp. Paûcharraddan, &c. to cause anyone to have the cramp. Aucharraddan, the cramp.
a large fruit, outwardly not unlike the european pumpkin.
pinoch-poch, papóch-poch, to smoke, to make dusty. Papoch-boch, pinapoch-boch, papoch-boch, to cause to smoke, ipâpoch-bocha, ipapoch-boch, inipapoch-poch.
pi, pa, intend. podarrodárros, to go on further and further in doing anything. ex gr. podarrodarros o macheaûban, to make game first with one and then with the other.

pinodda, papódda, boddá, boddáan, binodda, inoboddaan, to bring forth, to breed; pabodda, pinabodda, papabodda, ipabodda, to cause to bring forth. Bodda, birth. Baboddaan. birth place. Ma-ababodda, fruitful. Poddo tattaula, to regenerate.
pinoddik, papóddik, to become thick, to swell, also to be swollen. Paûdik, pinaûdik, papaûdik, ipaudikka. ipaudik, &c. to cause to become thick. Audik, a swelling.
pinoddelon, papoddelon, to be costive. Pauddillo, pinauddillo, papaûddillo, ipauddilloa, ipaûddillo, &c. to cause costiveness.
pinoddo, papoddo, boddoa, boddoan, binoddoan, to calculate with an abacus. Papoddo, pinaboddo, papaboddo, ipaboddoa, ipaboddo, &c. to cause so to reckon. Boddo, an abacus.
pinóddodo, papóddodo, oddodoá. oddodan, inoddodoan, to complain. Pauddodo, pinaûddodo, papaûddodo, ipaûddodoa, ipauddodo, &c. to cause to complain.
pinoelakies, papoelakies, oelakisa, oelakísan, inoelakisan, to wander. to err from the way, to have a misunderstanding. Paulakies, pi, pa, ipaulakies, to cause to err.
a water bubble, a blister on the body. To be written, hoelassi.
pinotach, pipoetach, oetach-a, oetach-an, inoetachan, ino-oetachan, to stay anywhere. Paûtach, pinautach, papaûtach, ipaûtacha, ipautach, inipaûtach, ino pautach, to cause to remain.
pi, pa &c. as poetach. to remain anywhere long. Paûtaûtach, pi, pa, to cause to remain.

zh-def: 預備好做某事；埋伏；潛藏
ori-def: pi, pa, oetanna, oetannan, inoetannan, to do anything by way of provision, to lie in wait, or to lurk in secret. As poetan o aras, to fetch a quantity of grass.

pinoetat, papoetat, oetatta, oetattan, inoetattan, ino-oetattan, to mean, to suppose, to suspect. Paûtat, pinaûtat, papaûtat, ipaûtatta, ipaûtat, &c. to cause such to be done. Aûtat, nom. meaning. Ma-aûtat, a believer.
pi, pa, &c. intend. poetat, to mean sincerely, to believe firmly, nom. aûtaûtat, belief.

pinogámgam, papogámgam, ogagámma, ogamgammen, inogamgam, ino-ogamgammen. to do anything shorty or quickly after another. Pogámgam ja micham, to drink shortly after one another. Paûgamgam, pi, pa, ipaûgamgamma, ipaûgamgam, inipaûgamgam, inoipaûgamgam, to cause to be done.
pinólsi. papólsi, same as poddik. Paûlsi, pinaûlsi, papaulsi, ipaûlsia, ipaûlsi, inipaûlsi, same as Paûdik.

pinoggogo, papoggogo, oggogoa, to rub, in general either with paint, in which case it is oggogoon, inoggogoan, ino-oggogoan or by wiping, in which case it is oggogoan, inoggogoan. Poggogo no morr'o naûpoot, to wipe the face with a towel. Poggogo no rib o boar, to smear one's coat with mire. Paûggogo, pi, pa, ipaûggogoa, inpauggogo, &c. to cause to rub. Auggogo, nom. the wiping; also the instrument wherewith anything is wiped.

pinókbok, papókbok, bokbokka, bokbokken, binokbok, inobokbokken, to beat with the hand. Pábokbok,
pinabokbok, papabokbok, ipábokbokka, ipabokbok, inipabokbok, inoipabokbok, to do so.

pinokkor, papókkor, okkorra, okkorran, inokkórran, ino-okkórran, to put a stopper on anything, on a can,
&c. Paûkor, pinaûkor, papaukor, &c. to cause this to be done. Aukor, nom. a stopper. Pokkor, a peg.
pi, pa, ipolliboa, pass. ollibo4an, inolliboan, ino-ollibóan, to disguise, to conceal any dishonourable expression. Paûllibo, trans. Aûllibo, nom.
the navel.
the knee.
a night owl.
mould, the canker worm, see phon.
a Chinese.

a boil that comes of itself. For whenever any part of the body, as the head, swells up, or when any swelling
occurs through a fall, &c. the same is audik.

pinónnad, papónnat, onnadda, onnadden, inonnad, ino-onnadden, to make fire burn, to make a fire.
Paûnad, pinaûnad, papaûnad, ipaunadda, &c. to cause this to be done.

zh-def: 往中間推〈使兩旁或兩側的人必須讓路〉
ori-def:
pinochacha-a, paporchacha-a, borchacha-á, borchacha-an, binorchacha, inoborchachan, to push in
between so that people on either side must get out of the way. Paborchach-a, pinaborchach-a, &c.
to cause to be done.

pinorpor, papórpor, porpórran, pinorpórran, inoporporran, to raise. Papórpor, pináporpor, papaporpor,
ipaporporra, ipáporporr, ipáporpor, inipaporpor, inoipaporpor, to make dusty. Barrabór, dust.

pinórra, papórra, iporrá, borra, borráan, borráan, &c. to dry, to put out to dry. Paborra, pi, pa, to cause this
to be. Baborra, a drying. Babor an, babor aijan, a dying place, as a frame in which people dry flesh.

pi, pa, orrátta, pass. orrattan, inorráttan, ino-orrattan, to wager, to guess at any anything . Paûrrat, trans.
aurrat, nom.

zh-def: 迅速倒下〈如受致命傷的動物〉
ori-def: seems to mean, to fall suddenly down, as a beast that is mortally wounded, as if one should say, there it lies .
a measure made of bamboo.

pinorroog, paporroog, orroogga, orrooggan, inorroog, ino-orrooggen, to overthrow. Paûroog, pinauroog,
papauroog, paurogga, to cause to do so.

pinorrot, paporrot, borrotta, borrotten, bi crrot, inoborrotten, to bind. Paborrot, pinaborrot, papáborrot, 
ipáborrotta, ipáborrot, papáborrot, ipáborrotta, ipáborrot, &c. to cause to bind. Baborrot, a binding.

pínosa, papósa, osaá, osaán, niosaán, inosaán, to make the ground clean, by the rooting out of weeds 
or jungle. Paüsa, pinaûsa, papausa, ausa-a, ipausa, inipausa, &c. see Mausa.
pinosi, paposi, osia, osi-in, inosi, ino-osian, to scour, to whiten. Paus, pinausi, papausi, ipausia, ipausi, inipausi, to cause to be scoured.

pinosi, paposi, osiam osien, inósi, ino-osien, where? osian, inosian, inoosian, to stow anything away.
Pausi, pinausi, papausi, ipausis, &c. to cause to do so. Osi, a sheltering.

pinossirrere, papossirrere, bosxsirrerea, bossirreri-in, binosirrere, ino-bosirrerein, to hang up by 
the neck. Pabosirrere. pi, pa. ipabosirrerea, ipabosirrere, inipabosirrere, to suspend; people say
also Pausirrerea.

inosisi, paposisi, osisia, osisian, inosisi, and inosisian, ino-osisian, to end, to leave off.
Pasisi o rior, and sisi o rior, to be the last. Pausisi, pi, pa, ipausisia, ipausisi, inipausisi, inoipausisi,
to cause to end.

zh-def: 〈以當地人的方式〉綁頭髮；裝飾頭髮；綑綁青草；以草結裝飾田地或某地
ori-def:
pinosos, paposos, osossa, osossen, inosos, ino-osossen, to put up the hair in the native 
manner, to bind together grass, to dress the head, to adorn a field or any place with knots of grass.
But then, osossa, inosossan, ino-ossosan are used. Pausos, pi, pa, ipaûsossa, to cause such 
to be done.

pinossor, papossor, bossorra, bossorran, binossorrar, inobossorran, to castrate. Pabossoor,
pinabossor, papabossor, to cause the same to be done.
pi, pa, ottaia, ottaián, inottaián, ino-ottaian, to sleep on the same bed, and under the same covering.

pinottan, papottan, ottanna, ottánnan, inoittannan, ino-ottannan, to lie in wait in secret. Pautan,
pinautan, papautan, ipautanna, inipautan, inoipautan, to cause such to be done. This is the
same with Poetan, above, for if any one will surprise another secretly, he must first lie in wait.
a knot, a knuckle, a knot in wood.

pinottup, papottup, otuppa, ottuppen, inottup, ino-ottuppen, to put out; sjajo, potup o chau, elli
mamaninabonna, of you had put out the fire, it would not have burnt my field: ja
ottuppen ja tattullonoe, is the candle put out? Pautap, pinautap, &c. to cause to be put out:
ipautuppi Takalla ja tattullonoe, let Takalla put out the candle.

pinottup, papottup, otuppa, ottuppen, inottup, ino-ottuppen, to put out; sjajo potup ochau, elli maman inabonnam if you had put out the fire, it would not have burnt my field: ja otuppen ja tattullonoe, is the candle put out? Pautap, pinautsp, &c. to cause to he put out: ipzuppi Takalla ja tattullonoe, let Takalla put out the candle
pi, pa, oulaboa, same as Moah.
pinoz-i, papoz-i, oz-ia, inoz-i, ino-oz-ieu, to awaken. Pauz-i, pin#uz-i, papauz-i, ipauz-ia, ipauz-i, inipauz-i, inotpauz-i, to cause to awake

pinozios, papozios, oziossa, oziossan, inozinossan, to come in any one's place, to succeed any one. Pauzios, pinauzios, papauzios, ipauziossa, inipauzios, inoipauzios, to cause to succeed. Ozios, succession. Mzaózios, successor.
pinozirries, papozirries, ozirrisa, pzirrisan, inozirrisan, ino-ozirri-san, to miss one's aim. Pauzirries, pi, pa, ipauzirrisa, &c. to cause one to miss the mark.
the hard gummiress which sometimes sticks to the eye lashes
pineries, paperies, iperisa, iper##, iniperies, inoiperies, to be close. Pabries, pi, ,pa, ipabrisa, ipabries, inipabries, to cause it to be done.
pientat, paptat, ptadda, pass. ptaddan, pientaddan, to begin, to do anything from the first. Paptat, nom.
pienso, papto, ptoa, pass. ptoon, piento, inoptoon, same as ptat. Papto, same as paptat.
pinûlla, papûlla, bulla-a, bulla-an, binulla-an, inobulla-an, to knock in pieces. Pabûlla, pinûbulla, papabulla, ipabulla, to cause to be brokern to pieces. Written poulla.
a little
a faggot
smelt, a fish
the clouds
a joint, as between the knots of bamboos. Writen Raag, the verb, Paraag, see the letter P
the betel-leaf
a scar
wrath. anger. From Marais
a burnt field
a hillock
the mouth, the conversation
a leopard
a well
a furrow
an eye tooth
blindness. See Marapal
bad, in general. Verb Marapies, to be wicked. Ma-arapies, a bad man.
(let the a be scarcely heard.) beneath. Morpo, the verb to be low. Patapo, pi, pa, to cause to be low
a low place in a field, where rain water collects rûas
a groaning. From Rummain.
a song of many. From Rummait
old; contracted.
a neighbors house. Raûmraûdon, a neighbor. Raraûdon o sjam o sini, neighbour man or woman.
a possession, or land mark
a separation
the parting of a river

zh-def: 為了用刀劃的條紋標記
ori-def: a stripe marker off with a knife for a measure
a ring or ferrol, made to fasten anything.
a hat, a dog's collar. Raro daal, a straw hat. Raro osan, a bank.
a pot.
the after birth
the gums
bandages, with which anythinng is bound in order not to burst.
a cage
a hind
unwise, half foolish, as rûchoen, compounded of rau and saan because the understanding is wauting.

zh-def: 閃爍，但僅是在黑色的背景下
ori-def: ri, ra, raûsûnna, rausannan, rinausannan, to shine, to glister, but is only said of that which had a black ground, otherwise it is madallolees.
it is fallen; there it lies
dried fish or flesh
the eaves of a house
the throat

zh-def: 各式長短或形式都能遮住肩膀的上衣
ori-def: all sorts of upper garments, that cover the shoulders no matter of what form or length
or ribókkebok, a lined coat or jacker
a bank, not entirely covered by water, the strand, a sandbank.
a small house, where men put seed.
a mosquito. From Maries
a hand; rim o kallamas, the right hand; rim o kaixi, the left hand.
the space between the legs.
(the e short) o erien, a pair of legs, as the hind legs of a deer, &c. joined as they are in nature
an egg
after. From Mûrior. Matarior, to be behind. Patarior, trans.

zh-def: 圍繞著火的工具，人們將鍋放在鍋上燒開，當地人只放三顆石頭
ori-def: instruments about a fire place, where people set the pot on to boil, as with us trevets, roasters, &c. the natives, however, merely fix three stones in the ground.
household, furniture.
a native eating bowl.
distance, depth. Masanno a ro in Taijoan oe, how far is Taiwan? Masanno a ro ja chauch oe, how deep is the well?
the stalk or stem of a plant.
a grave.
a sack.
a common sort of arrows.

zh-def: 某種叫做 rabos 的魚
ori-def: a certain fish called rabos.
a hawk.
a wart; also a button on clothes
another; plur. roma-roman
a shadow, as of an umbrella shed, or tree, &c. but not from #### which is dachûm, See #####
remainder.
the bottom of anything, especially the fundament of the body.

zh-def: 海岸，也是 Bossor 的字源
ori-def: a shore, also a root as Bossor.
(the ô contracted) a consort.
rinorieb, inororieben, to grow dizzy, as if every thing went round, and people did not know where they were.

zh-def: 一堆像木頭、稻草、稻田、小米之類沒生命的東西
ori-def: one with another, altogether, a heap of lifeless things, as wood, straw, paddy, millet, &c. Hence is derived rorronoûda, to disttribute equally; parorronoada, to cause such to he done.
ginger.
tears.
ri, ra, rubboa, rubboon, parûbbo, trans. to grind. Rarubbo, meal. Rarubboan, or rarûbbo aijanm nail work.

rinûmchorcho, rarûmchorcho, to pitch up and down, as a ship at sea, or a weak bamboo, on which anything is carried. Pûarchorcho, pi####horcho, papûarchorcho, ipûarchorcho, &c to cause this to be done.

rinûmka, rarûmka, to gather branches. Pûarka, pinûarka, pnpûarka, ipûarka-a, &c. to do the same. To separate from one another, as the branches of tress, shoot out on all ####. Rumkara, nom. # shooting out, as the branches of trees.
ri, ra, rala, rûlen, rinaal, the (u) short, to sit on one's heels, as tsimsakal. Paraal, to cause this to be done

rinûmmab, araûmmab, received, pregnant, impregnated; also to pass by any time in doing anything. Then it is raba aud rabea, raban, rinaban, inoraban. Naraap o rummios tapos assaban rûmmûb elli tatumkach, six days the village will let pass by, that they do not go out to hunt, see Porab. Raben, rinab, inoraben, pregnancy is occasioned, rarb, nom. subs. rûmmab o sini, the woman is pregnant.

rinûmmaha, rarûmmaba, raba-a, rabaûn, to cover with the wings, as birds do thier young. Also to take any one for a father, in order to serve or help him. See paraba: raraba, a breeding: raraban, a breeding place.

zh-def: 談到人們無法通過遠距離或黑暗或任何其他障礙物無法看清的任何事物
ori-def: is said of anything that people cannot well see either through distance or darkness, or any other obstruction
rinummain, rarummainrûinarainen, rinain, inorainen, to petrify. Parain, pinûrain, papûrain, ipûraina, ipûrain, inipûrain, inoiparain, &c to cause to be petrified.

zh-def: 假裝某物是屬於自己的
ori-def: rinummûmmik, rarûmmûmmìk, ramka, to take the property to another, under pretences that it belongs to ourselves; with regrad to the ###ter it is said ramlin, rinammik, inorûmkin: and to the person, ramkan, rinûmkan. Parammik, pinûrammik, paparammik, ipûramka, iparammik, to cause such to be done.
rìnûmmûpal, rûíhmapal, rapûlla, rapallen, rinapal, to beat about ####dly Parapal, trans. rarapal, a ####ding. Ma-arûrapal, a blinder.
rinûmmait, rarûmmait, raida, raian, rinaidan, inoraidan, to sing in ####us. Paraid, pinarait, papûrait, iparaida, iparaid, iniparaid, inoparaid, to do so.

rinûmmapies, rarûmmapies, eapisa, rapisen, rinapies, inorapiesen, to be evil. Parapies, trans. to cause any ###in. Imper. iparapisa, iparapies, ##esa rûmmapies o airien oe, to spoil ##t any one has made or done. Ra## airien, the work is spoiled, nom rarapies, sin, also ûrapiessen marapies. Ma ûrarapies, a sinner. Rûm###rapies, intend. rapieapies, nom.

rinûmmaried, rarûmmaried, rarida, raridan, raridan, rinaridan, inoraridan, to make a division of land. Pararied, pinararied, papararied,  &c. to cause such a separation. Raried, nom, a separation. Rariedan and raried aijan, the place where the fields dicide

rinûmmach, rarûmmaûch, raûcha, raûchan, rinaûchan, inoraûchanm, to uncover the head for any one. Paraûch, pi, pa, iparaûcha, ipûrauch, &c. to cause the head to be uncovered. Ta Albert iparaûch o raro ta capitain ja sisjim, the children are charged by Albert to uncover the head before the Captains.

rinûmmaro, rarûmmaro, raroa, raroan, rinaroan, inoraroûn, to put on the hat, to put a collar on a dog. Pararo, pinararo, papûraro, paraûraroa, roa, oa, intede, ipararo, &c. to cause the hat to be put on, or a collar to be put on a dog. Raro, a har, a collar
rinummûno, rinummaûno, araûmmaûno, raúnoa, raûnoon, rinûûno, inoraunoon, to behead. Parauno, pinarauno, paparaûno, ipûraûnoa, ipûraùno, iniparaûno, inoiparauno, to cause to be beheaded.

ranummaut, rarûmmaut, rauda, raudan, rinaûdan, inoraûdan, to remian out; innai dema joa rummaût a milip ai; wherefore do you remain so long out? Paga sasaita Cabba, sa a rummaût de d' Hallibo Cabba will not come, he remians at Hallibo. Pûraut, pinaraut, paparaut, iparauda, iparaut, to cause to remian out. Rûmmaûraût, &c. paraûmût &c as above, to remian long out, or cause this to be done.
ri, ra, imp. redos, pass, parido, trans. to draw a bow
rinummedos, roddossa, rodossen, riendos, inorûddossen, to snuff up. Pûardos, pinardos, papaardos, ipaardossa, ipûardos, inipaardos, inoipaardos, to cause to snff up
ri, ra, rea, rees, rine, inoreen, to speak hard. Also to poke out the belly as if blown out, to threaten the opposite of kummibach, also to boast. Pare, trans. Ma-arare, a hard speaker
ri, ra, reessa, reesen, rinees, inoreessen, same as Chummisel.
rinûmmemorémo, rarûmmemoremo, remoremoa, remorémoan, rinimorémo, inoremoremoan, rontom, to look all around. Paremoremo, pi, pa, iparemoremoa, iparemoremo, inipûremoremo, to cause thus tto bedone

rinûmmene, raûmmene, rinmea, rinmeen, rinmene, inorinmeen, to cause to soak; that in which renean, rinean, inorinnean. Paarne, pinaarne, pa. ipaaarnea, ipaarne, inipaarne,  inoipaarne, to cause this to be done. Nom, raarne, a soaking.
rinûmmere, raruere, rerea, réreanm rineran, inorerean, to go round, to encompass. Parere, pi, pa, iparerea, &c. to go on the other side, as if to get our of any one's eye

zh-def: 把一個東西從一個地方帶到另一個地方
ori-def: rinummeries, rarummeries, rerisa, rerisen, rineries, inorerisen, to put anything over from one place to another; pareries, pinûreries, papareries, &c. to cause such to be done.

rinummi, rarummi, ri-a, ri-in, rini, inori-in, to keep watch, to guard. Pûri, pinûri, papûri, iparia, &c. to cause watch to be kept. Rari, nom. a watch. Rarian, or rariaijan a watch house. Ma-arari, a watch-man

ri, ra, riboû, to hold the feast which is celebrated in the evening after marriage, to keep a wedding. Nom. rariba, obaan o rariba, a wedding. To keep a feast the day after marriage they call Ummior o rariba, de rariba, i.e. to follow up the marriage. And when they drink with the new married couple it is micham o rûmain.

rinummibal, rarummibal, riballa, riballen, rinibal, inoriballen, to pull down, also to separate. Pûribal, pinaribal, paparibal, ipariballa, iparibal, to break down. Raribal, a breaking up. Ma-arûibal, one who breaks.

zh-def: 飛來飛去，像遭受來自四面八方襲擊的人
ori-def: rinummibirrieh, rarummibirrieb, ribirriba, ribirriben, riuibirrieb, inoroibirribhen, to fly hither and thither, as those who are assailed on every side. Pûriberieb, pi, pa, ipariberiba, &c. to cause to do so.

rinummicheriech, rarummicheriech, richericha, richerichen, rinicheriech, to make a mark with a knife or such like, in order to fix a measure. Paricheriech, pi, pa, iparichericha, &c. to cause to be marked off, This does not mean to cut through a rope or bamboo with a knife or saw.
rinum: rarum: richumma, to cut off a bamboo or stick even Pariehum, trans. rarichum, nom, subst.

rirummiedda, rarummiedda, riedda, rieddan, rinieddan, inoriieddan, to make a separation. Parieddan, &c. to cause such to be done. Rariedda, a separation. Rarieddan and aijan, the place where the way separates. Rûmmia, as rûmmiedda.
a lapse of days. Ratórroa rummies, three days; Masanno rummies, how many days.

zh-def: 以自然的方式弄乾皮膚
ori-def: rinummiel, rarummiel, rila, rilen, riniel, inorilen, to dry skins in the native manner by spreading them out, in the rariel, nom. such stretching out. Pariel, pinariel, papariel, iparila, ipariel, inipariel, to make dry
rinum: rarum: riebrieba, same as rummichum, and rûmmisûp.
the whole; from Marmo.

zh-def: 轉向或幫別人從這一側轉到那一側
ori-def: rinummiggo, rarummggo, riggoa, riggoon, riniggo, to turn one's self, or anything  else, from one side to the other; in which sense it agrees with poaried. Also to remove anything from one shoulder or hand to the other: that on which it is laid is roggoan. Pûriggo &c. to cause such to be done. Also to change, as rummiggo o ramied, to change, as rummiggo o ramied, to change one's word. See Mariggo. Riggoriggo, changeableness. from rûmmiggorriggo. Rummiggorriggo, intend. rûmmiggo

rinummikak, rarummikak, rukakka, rikûkken, rinikak, inorikakken, to stride. Parikak, pinarikak, paparikak, iparikakka,ipanikak, iniparikak,inoiparikak, &c, to cause to ### to be done. Rarikak, a striding.
ri, ra, rarikorikoa, to move backwards and forwards. Parikoriko, tran.
rinummiot, rarummiot, riótta, riotten, riniot, inoriotten, to environ, compass. Pariot, pinariot, papa## &c. to cause such to be done.
a kind of fish.

rinummiseries, rarummiseries, riserisa, riserisen, riniseries, inoriserisen, to wash rice or millet. Pûriseries, pinûriseries, papariseris, ipariserisa, ipariseries, inipûriseries, inoipariseries, to cause such to be done.
rinum: rarum: risûppa, same as rummichum. Parisup, transit,
rinummomirroom, rammmomirroom, romirroma, romirromen, rinomirroom, inoromirroom, to rinse the mouth. Paromirroom, pi, pa, iparomirroma, ipûromirroom, inipàromirroom, inoiparomirroom, &c. to do so.

zh-def: 在齒間用水發出咕噥聲
ori-def: ri, ra, roggoroggoa, to rumble water between the teeth, as when people wash their mouth, to gurgle
rinummomorromo, rammmomorromo, romorromoa, romorromoon, rinomorrómoon, inoromorromoon, to make round. Pûromorromo, pinaromorromo, paparomorromo, iparomorromoa, to cause such to be done.
rinummonno, rarummonno, rónnoa, ronnoan, rinonnoan, inorónnoan, to overshadow. Paronno, trans. rarosnno, a shadowing.
rinummoop, rarummoop, rópa, rópen, rinóop, inoroópen, to shut the eyes. Paróop, pinaroop, paparoop, &c. to cause such to be done.

zh-def: 從嘴中吐出東西但不是唾沫
ori-def: ri, ra, ropû, eropa, ineropû, inoeropû, to spit anything out of the mouth, but not spittle, for that is petûmmo. Paropû, trans. raropa, a spitting out.
rinummoos, rarûmmoos, rosû, rosen, rinoos, inoroosen. to run after, to pursue. Paroos, pinûroos, papûroos, iparosa, &c. to cause to pursue.

rinummorro, rarummorro, rorroa. rorroon, rinorro, inororroon, to call together, to put together, as clothes in a chest, drink in a pot, paddy in a sack, &c. also parorro, see in Parórro. Also to encircle. Rummorronocho, to encircle any one. Parorro, an assembly, act. arórroan, or aroroaijan, a place of assembly.
rinummorosûn, rarummorosan, to gasp at the point of death.
runrmmorroos, rarummorroos, rorrosa, rorrosen, rinorroos, inororrosen, to collect, to gather. Parorroos, pinarorroos, paparorroos, iparorrosa, iparorroos, to cause to gather.
rinummot, rarummot, rotta, rotten, rinot, inorotten, to wrap up anything. Parot, pinarot, paparot, to cause to be wrapped up. Rarot, a wrapper.
ri, ra, ruttossa, tuttossen, rinotos, inorotossen, to go against anything, as against the wind, stream, &c. Paûttos, transiti. Rarotos, such a going. Maararotos, such a goer.

zh-def: 自以為是，剝奪了他人的一切
ori-def: ri, ra, rotulla, rotullen, rinotul, inorotullen, to take to one's self, and thus to deprive another of anything. or to cause that he has it not. Parotul, trans. rarotul, nom. a depriving. Ma-ararootul, one who deprived.

rinumpe, rarumpe, ruppea, rûppein, rienpe, inoruppein, to swallow up, Paarpe, pinâarpe, papûarpe, ipûarpea, &c. to cause to be swallowed up. Raruppe, a swallowing. Rûrâûppe, o man, o micham, the passage where eating and drinking goes thro'.
but; for.
a partridge.
looseness, a diarrhœa.
when; sasai o sabûnnojoa mamau oe, when will your father come ?
a river
poverty, from Masaba.
a mouth
a street; from Summabad.
a carp, that is full grown; autobabot, half grown; barobablyi, about a span long; dille o barobabbi, a young carp of a smaller sort.
afterwards; sacha a nataap rûmmies, after six days; sacha a nattada eidas, over a month; sacha a natorroa baas, after three years.
a screen, to make a shadow.
a mat, to sleep on.
a cheek.
the understanding.
the day after tomorrow.
the entrance of a house, including the door and threshold; inaúnûmina jo saide sandon ? talla alla mossei dummora don ? why do you stay at the door? why do you not come in?
envy, jealousy; see Masannan.
any unpleasant and stinking smell; anything that stinks, or is nasty, so that the senses loathe it.
a house or shed, such as is generally seen in front of native houses
the nump of the Indian cow.
a row of persons or things, that stand one after the other. Sarró mababat, to go one after the other. Sarro makarieb, ditto. From Pissûrra.
persons who come from one family, as Taborron. It must be pronounced sarr-o-don, and means a race, a line. See Pissarra
a crow.
pack thread.
the net that incloses the bowels.
mist, damp. Poch-poch a sûrroso, de bonna, the mist in the field. Sarrosoûn, misty.
the headkerchief of the men.
white coral beads, which the young women wear on ther legs. Sabitoi o sasaat, the red corals which they wear about these, Aud tatte opô, those which are worn underneath.

and sasosaijan, the place of anything, hence peo sassaian, a dwelling house. Sino saijan, and inosasaijan, this has no other tenses than these three, præsens, praet. and fut. pas. it means also simply a residence. Sasaijan omerien, a work place. Contracted from sasaû merien.

zh-def: 沒有遮蔽物，從房子望出去的景
ori-def: praet, pass. sinoainasan, praes. inosaûinas, fût. a look out house: this has no covering, and differs from tarrakal, which has a covering.
a cross, from Summaki motto.
deceit, from Sûmmûlla.
a ring, such as men wear on the fingers. From Summallan.
a spout.

zh-def: 一張紙，或任何攤開的東西
ori-def: a sheet, or anything spread out. Sasappo azaijan, a table cloth. Sasûp o ratta, a bed clothes. From summûppa.
water grass.
a notch. Root Sumûshien.
sinaas, to have a looseness.
a claw. From Summoat, or the clawing itself.

zh-def: 度量；將兩個東西的末端相連
ori-def: the measure, where two things with their ends are joined together.
thread, yarn. From Gummis.
a vessel in which people put food to settle, as with us, the skimming dishes.
salt. Sassi, the same.
fried grease.
an earthquake.
a kind of poison.
disinclination, dissatisfaction, a murmuring disposition: annûmma sasonos? what do you murmur about?
a pot, or cup. Written sasûlan.
if: sia moetas a simma, matalam cho alli sasos' i tumkach, if it rain tomorrow, the people will probably not go out to hunt.
a high mountain.
a marriedman, or one who has: been married: also a father.
the teeth: plur. sisjien.
anything broken off short: the back.

anything produced long, the end of a thing. Sies o atzaijan, the end of a table. Sies o bonna, the end of a field. Sies o abas, the end of the sea, where it washes the land. It is not applied to things that have no certain, quantity, like the word sisi, see below.
a bird's nest

zh-def: 小孩，無論是男孩或女孩
ori-def: a child, whether boy or girl. Sjiem badda, a boy. Siem maûnuali, "a girl. Sjiem pûrrach, a bastard. Sjiem pattûla, a step son. Sjiem o kakan, a sucking child. Sjiem o siem, a grandchild.
a large native knife.

zh-def: 村落或田野周圍的空地
ori-def: sinimida, sasimida, an open space round a village or a field, to keep off fire. Pasida, trans. Sida, such a path.

sinimien, sāsimien, sina, sinan, siminan, inosinan, to be in the way between two, to strike in between two ways. Sina osi Ta Cabba inaos, come between me and Cabba. Pûsien, pinasien, papasien, &c. to cause this to be done. Sasien, nom. the name of that which people set between two.

zh-def: 像懶人消磨時間般晃動雙腳
ori-def: sinimikasik, sasimikasik, sikasikka, sikasikken, sinikasik, inosikkasikken, to dangle with the legs or feet, as idle people do to drive away time. Pasikasik, pi. pa. ipûsikasik ka, &c. to cause such to be done.
sinimikósiko, sikosikoa, sikosikoon, sinikosiko, inosikosikoon, to drill, as people do with pikes. Pûsikossiko, pi. pa. ipasikosikoa, ipûsikosiko, &c. to cause such to be done.
sinimioch, sasimioch, siocha, siochen, sinioch, inosiochen, to bring before the hand, Pûsioch, pinûsioch, papûsioch, ipasiocha, ipasioch, inipasioch, to cause such to be done.
sinimipir, sasimipir, sipirra, sipirren, sinipir, inosipirren, to throw the wrong way, or behind one's hand. Pûsipir, pinasipir, papasipir, &c. to cause anything to be thus thrown.

zh-def: 用手掌或腳掌打破或壓扁東西
ori-def: sinimisich, sasimisich, sisicha, sisichen, sinisich, inosisichen, to break or flatten anything with the palm of the hand or foot. Sisichen orima ja bart, to crush the musquitoes with the hand. Tapos sisjiem sasai simisich na-a babat donja cho' asjiel, let all the children come and merely rub the flog with their feet. Pasisich, pi. pa. ipûsi sicht, ipasisich, inipasisich, inoipasisich, to cause such to be done.
sinimiri, sasiniri, sirig, siri-in, siniri, inosiri-in, to bawl out in the native manner. Pasiri, pi, pa. ipasiria, ipa siri, &c. to cause any one to bawl out.
sewet.
the thumb, the great toe.
sinimitik, sasimitik, sitikka, sitikken, sinitik, to bind anything tight, or to hawl anything tort. Pasitik, pinasitik, papûsitik, ipasitikka, ipasitik, inipasitik, to cause such to be done.
the female among beasts: applied: to men, it means a married woman, who has had children: or who is become old: in which case also an unmarried woman is called sini.
a certain bird, from which quills are obtained:
the end of anything; sisia oetas, the end of the rain: sisia makarieb, the end of traveling: sisia patite, the end of speaking: sisia tämmäap, the end of working.
the sun, a day: written zijs-ja.
a place where the grass is eaten of, and is now bare.
a wound.
the conjunction and.
the south. Matasoan, southward.

zh-def: 東邊天色的陰暗與風暴
ori-def: the darkness and storminess of the sky in the east: see summoloch.
a pestle, with which people beat paddy out of the stalk.
the length of anything.
a sickness consisting of: rotten teeth.
the yolk of an egg.
sinu bach, sasumbach, sabûcha, sabachen, sienbach, inosabach, to administer a certain poison, called sasabach. Pāsabach, pinäsabach, papāsabach, &c. to cause to be poisoned.
sinûmbo, sasumbo, iseboa, isebo, inisebo, inoisebo, to set anything down. Pûsebo, pinasebo, papasébo, ipûseboa, &c. to cause anything to be set down.

sinumkir, sasumkir, isekirra, inisekir, inoisekir, to press down. Sûmkir orarro, to dip in the water; to put the hat on firmly, or to press it down. Pûsekir, pinûsekir, papasekir, ipasekirra, &c. to cause such to be done. Sûmkir i tono cho, to dip a person in the water. Sasekir i tono christan, Christian Baptism.
sekirran, sienkirrah, inosikirran, the making up of the betel nut. Pasekir, pi. pa. &c. as above.
sinummaam, sasāmmaam, saamma, saammen, sinaam, inosaammen, to entangle or entrap. Pāsaam, pl. pa. 1pasaamma, lpasaa, Inlpasaam, &c. to cause to be entrapped.
siniammabas, sasāmmabas, sabassa, sabassen, sinabas, inosabas sen, to try, to tempt, to make a trial. Pasabas, pinasabas, papasabas, ipasa bassa, &c. to cause such to be done.
a trial, a temptation. Ma-asasabas, a tempter, one who tries.

si. sa.. imp. Sabadda, to arrange anything in rows, as fields, trees,
streets, plants, &c. Pasabad, trans.
si. Sa. Pasabougarro, trans, a certain manner of binding, as if it were braided.
sinummabot, sasummabot, sabotta, sabotten, sinabot, inosabotten, to do anything by guess, to guess at anything. Sümmabot osſimmot, to point out or lay out anything by guess.

sinummabsab, sasāmmabsab, Sabsabba, Sabsabben, sinabsab, inosabben, to whip, to beat any one openly. Pasabsab, pi. pa. ipûsabsabba, ipasabsab, &c. to causesuch to be done. Sasûbsab, such a blow, also the instru-ment, as a stick, &c.
sinummada, sasāmmada, sadda, Saddan,sinadda,inosaddan, to seek. Pasadda, pi. pa. &c. to cause to seek.

zh-def: 餓，渴望某物如同飢餓一般
ori-def: sinämmadich-iboch,sasummadich-iboch, sadaudich-ibocha, Sadaudich-iboch, sinadaudichiboch, inosadaudichiboch, to be hungry, to desire anything as hungry. Pasadich iboch, pi. pa, ipûsadich-ibocha, &c. to cause such to be done.
sinämmakimotto, Sasummakimotto, Sakimottoa, Sakimottoan, sinakimottoûn, inosakimottoûn, to make anything cross-wise, or with a cross Pāsakimotto, pi, aipasakimottoa, &c. to cause such to be done.
simummaksak, sasunamaksak, saksakka, saksakken, sitûksak, inosaksakken, to trample, to tread, to tread down. Pasaksak, pi, pa ipasak sakka, &c. to cause such to be done.
&c. the breaking forth of the morning in the east, Summaksak abajan, it dawns in the east.
sinum malla, sasunimalla, sal. la-a, Salla-an, sipalla, indsalla-an, to deceive with words or actions. Pasalla, pinasalla, papāsalla, ipûsalla, inipûsalla, incipasalla, to cause to be cheated,

zh-def: 任何能產生陰影的東西 (如雨傘)
ori-def:
sinummallaban, sasāmmallaban, sallabānna, sallabannan, sinallabannan, inosallabannan, that which makes a shadow, (as an umbrella, &c.) to overshadow any one orthing. Pûsalaban, pinäsalaban, papasallaban, ipûsallabanna, ipasallaban,
to cause such to be done.
sinum mallad, sasāmniallad, salladda, salladden, sinallad, inosûl ladden, to discover, to be aware of. Pasallad, pinasallat, papasallat, ipasalladda, &c. to cause to be discovered.
si. Sa.. imp. Samgeanna, pass. samgeannen, sinamgean, to offer, is originally a Chinese word, but a dopted by the Formosan and declined after their manner. Samgean, offering.
si. Sa. Samoa, Samoan, &c. to twist, a three fold cord. Pasamo, tran.
sinum mallan, sasummallan, sallanna, Sallannan, sinallanan, inosallanan, to put a ring on the hand. Pasallan, pi. pa. &c. to cause to be done.
imp. Sammisamma, Sam misamman, &c. to crown. Pasammi san. Sammisam, a crown, garland: sasammisam, a crowning, Ma-asasammisam, a crown maker.
sinummannasanna, Sasummannasannā, sinannasanna, san, nasanna, sannasamnûan, sinannasanna, inosannasamaan, to hiss at. Pasannasanna, pi. pa. ipasannasanna, inipasannasanna, &c. to cause to be hissed.

sinummaod, Sasummaod, saodda, sinaod, inosaodden, to pour out, either on purpose, or by accident. PaSaod, pinasaod, papasaod, ipasaodda, &c. to cause to be poured out. Masaod, neutr. see in M. the acti. of which is Pasaod. Sasaod, a pouring out.

sinummapar, sasummapar, Saparra, saparran, sinoparran, to grasp anything furiously, as those do who fear that it will escape them. Naa sinumpar o masarro, I have seized a young hind. Pasapar, pi. pa. ipasapara, ipasapar, &c. to cause to be thus seized.

zh-def: 把東西放在地上，沒有凳子、板子或其他東西
ori-def: sinummapiel, sasummapiel, sapilla, sapillan, sinapil. inosapilan, to set down on the ground, without stool, mat, or other article. Pasapil, pinasa pil, papasapil, ipasapilla, ipasapil, ini pasapil, to cause such to be done.
sinum mappa, sasunmapp sappa and Sappaja, sapanni, Sinapanni, inosapanni, to overspread. Pasappa, pi. pa. ipasappaija, ipāsappa, inipasap pa, to cause to be overspread.
sinuumara, Sasummara, sar ra, Sarranni, sinaranni, inisaranni, to lie down in order to sleep. Pasarra, pi. pa. ipăsarra, inipăsarra, inoipăsarra, to cause to lie down to sleep.
same as summalachkach
si, sa, to plait a rope of straw, i. e. from double. Saramoa, Sa ramoar, &c. Pasaramo, to cause such is be done. Sasûramo, a plaiting. a-asaromo, one who plaits.
Sinummar-O-asso, SaSu In mar-o-asso, to Seethe. Pasaro asso, pi. ps, sc. to cause to be seethed.
sinum marp, Sasummarp, sarpen, sinarp, inosarpen, the burning And singeing of fire. Pasarp, pinäsarp, papasarp, pasarpa, pasarp, Impasarp, the fire singeing or burning anything.
si. Sa. Sarriesa, sarriesen, simarries, inosarriesen, to lace, to string. Pasarries, tran. Sarries, thread.

zh-def: 變得有霧氣或變得潮濕
ori-def: sinum marroso, sasummarroso, to grow foggy or damp. Pasarroso, pl. pa. ipasarrosoa, ipûsarroso, imipûsarroso, to cause the same.
to cause the same.
see below under summoso.

siuûmmasjien, sasummasjien, Sasjima, Sasinan, Sinasinan, inosasinan, to notch, to make a notch, to make teeth. Pasasien, pinasasien, papasasien, ipasasina, &c. to cause to be notched. Sasasjien, the notching.
sinûmmaso, sasummaso, sasoa, sasoan, sinasoan, inosasoa, to swim. Pasaso, see above in Pa.
sinummasoom, sasummasoom, isasoma, isasoom, inisasoom, inoisûsoom, to join together, so that the ends come together, but not over or in each other. Pasasoom, &c.
sinummasi, sasummasi, sasi, sasian, sinasian, inosasian, to mix salt, as people do in food when it is being cooked, or after it is dressed, but is too insipid. Pasasi, trans. Sasi, salt. nom.
si. sa. the shaking of the ground. Sasio, nom. earthquake.
sinûmmatsat, sasummatsat, satsatta, satsatten, sinatsat, inosatsatten, to forge, as a smith. Pasatsat, pi. pa. ipûsatsatta, ipasatsat, inipûsatsat, inoipasatsat, to cause to be forged.
sinûmmedo, sasummedo, siddoa, siddóon, siendo, inosiddóon, to feel.

zh-def: 生吃食物，或單吃食物不配任何東西
ori-def: sinummatta, sasummatta, summattan, sinummattan, inosummattan, to eat food raw and undressed, or alone and without mixing with other food, (as flesh without rice, or rice without any additions.) Pasummatta, pinasummatta, papasûmmatta, ipasummatta, &c. to cause such to be done.
si. sa. sealla, pass. seûllan,  sineal, inoseûllen, to spy an enemy. Passeal, tran. Saseal, a spying.
si. sa. seitta, seitten, sineit, inoseitten, to pinch, to join, i. e. under, as pillik, but between two is lummabit.
sinummerik, sasummerik, sirka, sirken, sinirka, inosirken, to press, squeeze, or wring out. Pûsirk, pi. pa. pinûsirk, papasirk, &c. to cause such to be done. Summerik o loan, to milk the cows.
(the e short) si. sa, sitton, ***toan, sinittoan, inosittoan, to limp, **ûmmotul. Pasito, trans. Sasito, a limping. Ma-asasitto, one who limps.

sinummis, sasummis, sissa, ***sen, sinis, inosissan, to sew, also to stitch, in which case it is sissan, **san, inosissan: also to backstitch, in which case it is isis, misis, ino***, **sis, pinasis, papasis, ipasi***, ip***, inipasis, to cause to be sewed.
